page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The history of Kirkham dates back over one thousand five hundred years, to the time of the Roman occupation of Britain (ending in 418AD).A Roman Fort existed in this area.The parish church of St.Michael dates from about 680 A.D. There is a record in the Domesday Book of 1087. Cotton was once a thriving industry in Kirkham and there were four mills.Progress Mill remains as small factory units for guitar making,car repairs,match making and textile making.A weekly market is held in the open market square by the fish stones (1748) and ancient lamp post. Many residents work at British Aerospace making aircraft or at the nuclear plant at Salwick.Many travelto Preston to work.There is still a tradition of a carnival each summer.The population is about 6000.
